Given a set <math display="inline">X</math>, a partial ordering is a transitive, antisymmetric relation <math display="inline">E \subseteq X \times X</math>.

''Note: a partial ordering will be called strict when <math>x E x</math> does not hold for any <math>x</math>, otherwise it is reflexive''
